fields.headline: 'I wouldn't change places with him'
fields.bodyText: Everyone knows that Beckham is the best dead-ball taker in the world, but he's much more than that. He's brilliant and intelligent - and a lovely bloke. Raul, Real Madrid captain I wouldn't want to change places with him. The attention is so great that he can't even leave the house. I think it's too much, but he is an excellent footballer. Vicente, Valencia midfielder Beckham may not quite be up to Zidane, one of the greatest ever, but he's an exceptional player, who brings something some stars maybe lack - real work-rate, an exceptional attitude and endeavour. Javier Gudino, Castilla La Mancha TV It's very difficult for Beckham to play in the centre. I think he's very limited there. I feel that his best form of contributing - and his only form of contributing at the highest level - is wide on the right. John Toshack, former Real coach It's no surprise that Beckham played well against us. He is, after all, one of the best players in the world. Victor Fernandez, Betis manager Beckham is more of a pop star than a footballer. Pele He will struggle with the Spanish pace, passion and greatness. Michel, former Real Madrid winger and TV commentator
